#Text=African nations gather to support a ban on cluster bombs
#Text=Thursday , April 3 , 2008
#Text=A 39-nation coalition in Africa passed a declaration on Tuesday to ban cluster bombs in a nearly unanimous vote .
#Text=The gathering in Lukasa , Zambia was the first meeting of the Cluster Munition Coalition ( CMC ) in Africa .
#Text=" Africa is ready for Dublin , " summarised Zambian delegate Robert Mtonga , referring to the upcoming May 19-30 meeting in Ireland to discuss a global ban on the weapons . "

column1: #Text=In a released statement the CMC said that 19 African countries , including South Africa , have endorsed the Wellington Declaration .
#Text=The Wellington Declaration is the basis for the upcoming negotiations at the Dublin Diplomatic Conference in Ireland in May .

#Text=While countries such as Germany and the United Kingdom have tabled the idea of a " transition period " during which time cluster bombs would remain a legitimate weapon of war , the African delegation was resolutely against the idea , calling for an immediate ban .

column1: #Text=Cluster munitions are dropped from aircraft , opening in mid-air and releasing a large number of smaller explosives over a wide area .
#Text=Writer Theodora Williams stated that their use usually results in " ... the death and maiming of thousands of innocent civilians " .
#Text=There are currently 13 African nations that possess cluster bombs although Uganda has recently announced they are destroying their stockpiles .
#Text=The weapons have been used in eight African conflicts in the past 35 years .

#Text=In addition to Ethiopia , Morocco , Nigeria and the Sudan , other nations known to have used the weapons are the former Yugoslavia , Eritrea , France , Israel , the Netherlands , Russia , Saudi Arabia , Sudan , Tajikistan , the United Kingdom and the United States .
#Text=According to the San Francisco Chronicle , the United States , China , Russia , and Israel have resisted any ban on cluster bombs , arguing that they can be used in self-defense .
#Text=The San Francisco Chronicle reported that the United States has lobbied allies to create loopholes in the upcoming Oslo treaty , to allow for the use of cluster bombs .
#Text=Reuters reported that a U.S. official had stated that cluster bombs should not be banned if they are used responsibly in state conflicts .
#Text=In October 2007 , Uganda became the first African country to state it would destroy its cluster bomb stockpiles .
#Text=Uganda has announced a pan-African meeting to take place after the Dublin meeting , which would seek to garner support for the signing of a treaty in Oslo set to take place in December 2008 .
#Text=The weapons have been used in eight African conflicts in the past 35 years .
#Text=The CMC is an international network composed of over 250 civil society organizations in 60 countries , with the stated aim of protecting civilians from cluster munitions .
#Text=Members of the CMC have been working to complete an international treaty to ban cluster munitions by 2008 .
#Text=At the February CMC committee meeting in New Zealand , only 82 of the 122 nations present endorsed a draft ban on the production , usage or storage of cluster bombs .
